meanings.definition: To change the scale of something.
meanings.sent1: I will rescale the map to make it fit on one page.
meanings.sent2: She had to rescale the recipe to feed more people.
meanings.sent3: Trying to rescale a mountain to fit in a backpack would be quite a challenge!
meanings.sent4: The idea of rescaling time itself to fix mistakes is intriguing.
meanings.sent5: In order to rescale the impact of his words, he spoke louder and clearer.

meanings.definition: To adjust the size or proportions of something.
meanings.sent1: The tailor had to rescale the dress to fit the customer perfectly.
meanings.sent2: It's important to rescale the image so it fits the frame.
meanings.sent3: I tried to rescale the building model, but it ended up looking like a tiny toy!
meanings.sent4: She felt like she needed to rescale her ambitions to match her current situation.
meanings.sent5: The artist decided to rescale the painting to highlight the details more effectively.
